page.title: 01INFORMATION ON SADDLEWORTH
page.content:
This area includes parts of the villages of Diggle and Uppermill, and extends over Saddleworth Moor.
There are two main areas which are inhabited, both being new estates, and there are scattered hamlets, such as at Pobgreen. Otherwise, there are isolated farmsteads on the higher ground, and the rest of the area is uninhabitable, being open Pennines moorland, which is boggy in parts.
The summit on the ridge over Uppermill and Diggle is Broadstone Hill (454 m.) and the A635 road to Holmfirth reaches 485 m.as it rises over the moors at at the eastern boundary of the area.
The main features of the area are its farming, recreation, industry, and above all, traditions of Saddleworth.
